Articles.Content:
Do you play any other exept of ksp???

I just play ksp no other games

Thread about other KSP games moved over to General Discussion.

I mostly play KSP, but I also enjoy Wargame:Red Dragon and dabble a bit in Cities:Skylines.

While waiting for 1.1 to release I've played a LOT of Darkest Dungeon. I'm also supposedly playing Just Cause 3, but I've not touched it in about 2 weeks.

On my phone I've been a bit addicted to Soda Dungeon.

Hmmm.  Other games, you say?  I seem to remember something about other games... 

Seriously, it's mostly KSP.  I occasionally play Civ 4, though.

Happy landings!
Well everyone plays another games. xD
The only other one I still go back to now and then is the Sims2...  I have a huge mega-hood that I like to visit when reality gets too... well, real.
I play Universe Sandbox2 also, for those moments when KSP is too time-consuming to be worth spending ten or so minutes on.

Lately, it's been KSP when I can squeeze in the time, but also many others, depending on my mood.  Fallout 4, Dragon Age Inquisition, The Witcher 2 (haven't finished it yet and W3 is also on my hard drive), Deus Ex, Homeworld, Homeworld: Deserts of Kharak, Pharoah, Baldur's Gate, Skyrim, Oblivion, Morrowind.

Also, my housemate has finally worn me down and I've been playing around a bit in Dungeons and Dragons Online with her and my daughter.  I NEVER play online games, so this was a big change for me, and as long as I don't have to deal with people I don't know, I guess I'm okay with it.

I've been avoiding KSP lately because everything I want to get done in it is a little too close to work. Didn't much get in to Fallout 4, so a lot of my gaming time has gone back to FTL, although I did spend a lot of time lost in Stardew Valley recently.

I have three younger brothers spread across half of Australia, and we keep in touch by playing multiplayer games together. The games we play vary; Minecraft, Project Zomboid and L4D are perennial favourites. But there's also more obscure stuff like Widelands.
I dabble in SW:BF on console, but have been playing Stardew Valley really heavy. It's a fantastic game for the price.

Plenty. Been playing Europa Universalis IV lately, just finished my first save though so will give it a rest. Loads of hours in Cities: Skylines. And lots on my 3DS, nearly finished Super Mystery Dungeon and got a Mario & Luigi game waiting to be started.

For a long time KSP killed all other games, but over the last year I've been dabbling in some others.  EliteDangerous was great for a while, but after reaching a certain point it started becoming really repetitive (and I broke my joystick on it!).  I play CS:GO from time to time, mostly just to keep my aim in. Last year I re-played System Shock 2 with some graphics mods, seriously still a great game!  Was also re-playing DeusX human revolution, but stopped when the KSP pre-release came out (but I'm really looking forward to the next DeusX!) 
Recently I discovered another early access game; GRIP, it's the spiritual successor to Rollcage which I used to love back in the day. It's pretty good, but only as 3 tracks and 2 car types currently, but great for a quick burst of speed!
Mostly KSP, although I have played some of The Escapists and Universe Sandbox2

4 hours ago, stibbons said:

Didn't much get in to Fallout 4, so a lot of my gaming time has gone back to FTL,

You are the first person outside the FTL forum I have seen that also plays FTL, (other than the YTers) 

For me I have been playing:

Universe Sandbox2,

Warhammer 40K Dawn Of War,

Shadowrun Dragonfall (I completed Returns a month ago),

Valkyria Chronicles, 

Terraria,

SAS Zombie Assault 4,

I haven't played FTL in a while, but I will play it when I get back to working on Faster Than Lunch (a mod I am making for FTL),

Civ 5,

Cortex Command (it's a great game, I am also working on a mod for it),

TubeTycoon.

I think that's all 

Edited April 16, 2016 by CAKE99
That took me 13 minutes to write XD

when i not diging in KSP logs, mods or pretend play KSP  i am lurk in diferite game depend by mood Tom Clancy's The Division, World of Warships, Diablo 3, WoW, Fractured Space, Star Wars - The Old Republic, Hots or what ever i fell like on that day or moment

I play many other games, but never at the same time as KSP. If I started playing KSP then it entirely consumes my gaming life until I stop playing it, at which point I don't play it for many many months. Then I start playing it again and the cycle repeats

It's mostly KSP but I do have a few idle games that I check into and edit as needed.  I also play endless sky(was free on steam) when I need a little break from my Kerbals or if I only have half an hour or less to play something
Outside KSP i play from the depths, war thunder, mount and blade warband, and when im feeling really bored powder toy
KSP and Minecraft. I also got Trackmania Turbo a few days ago and have been rekking n00bs on Canyon Grand Drift (I used to play A LOT of Trackmania 2 Canyon so I'm pretty damn good at it).
Mainly Undertale and Destiny

One word: Orbiter. It's like KSP but more realistic, considering it's based on earth and while it may be a little hard to start, it gets easy fast.

I'm into World of Warships, which is like orbiter but with boats with big cannons on them.
I don't play anything atm, but I can't wait to try the new Rimworld version!

I really like Team Fortress 2, Garry's Mod and Goat Simulator for games on my Computer, however when It comes to console games I really like playing Nintendo games such as Zelda or Mario, but back when I had a PC I was addicted to Microsoft Flight Simulator X (I was good on takeoff, but was the worst at landing.)

39 minutes ago, Jeb1969 said:

I was good on takeoff, but was the worst at landing.

I rate my landings by how far the ground crew has to walk to pick up all the pieces.
I played quite a lot of Fallout 4 lately, also some TF2 and minecraft.
